title: 'We see the queue for food growing day by day'
description: An anti-hunger charity sees unprecedented demand for surplus food during cost of living crisis.

title: Concert For Ukraine: Refugees' stories centre stage at £12m charity show
description: Ed Sheeran, Camila Cabello and Eurovision winner Jamala help raise funds at the Concert For Ukraine.

title: Ukraine peace talks: The West calls for actions not words from Russia
description: The West calls for actions not words after the first sign of progress in peace talks.

title: Rise of the five-year-old 'TikTots'
description: Children as young as five are regularly using social media despite the rules, a survey finds.

title: Kyrgios docked game for racquet smash in Miami
description: Nick Kyrgios is docked a game in a tempestuous Miami Open last-16 defeat by Italy's Jannik Sinner.

title: Why the Red Cross has to be neutral in the Ukraine conflict
description: The ICRC is worried that its operations might be undermined by misinformation about its work.

title: Queen hears tributes to her 'beloved Philip'
description: The 95-year-old monarch overcomes her mobility problems to honour Prince Philip.

title: Queen thanks DofE winner Doyin Sonibare after Prince Philip thanksgiving speech
description: Duke of Edinburgh Gold Award winner Doyin Sonibare delivers an address to senior royals at Westminster.

title: China gains a foothold in Australia's backyard
description: A Pacific island's invitation to China's military threatens to destabilise Oceania.

title: Waitrose in row with Asda over 'Just Essentials' budget range
description: Rival supermarket Waitrose says its own similarly-named discount brand "Essential" range is trademarked.

title: UK seizes first superyacht in British waters
description: The £38m yacht, named Phi, is owned by an unnamed Russian businessman, the government says.

title: P&O Ferries says sacking U-turn would cause collapse
description: P&O's boss hits back at the transport secretary after he called on the company to reverse its decision.

title: Queen attends Prince Philip memorial service at Westminster Abbey
description: The Duke of Edinburgh's dedication to duty was praised at a memorial service at Westminster Abbey.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: Abramovich spotted in Istanbul peace talks
description: The Russian billionaire was seen as the talks began, following reports that he suffered poisoning symptoms.

title: Twenty fines to be issued over No 10 lockdown parties
description: Police say 20 fixed penalty notices will initially be issued over Downing Street parties that broke the law.

title: Decathlon backtracks on Russia after boycott calls
description: The sporting retailer has halted its business in Russia after criticism of its decision to stay.

title: El Clasico: Match set to break women's crowd record - but is it a one off?
description: More than 90,000 tickets have been sold for Barcelona's Champions League quarter-final second leg with Real Madrid at the Nou Camp.

title: University rugby player dies weeks after match injury
description: Maddy Lawrence, 20, died from injuries she suffered in a tackle during a match on March 7.

title: Saudi Arabia could host Usyk-Joshua in late June
description: Saudi Arabia could host the Oleksandr Usyk-Anthony Joshua rematch in late June, according to the Ukrainian's promoter Alexander Krassyuk.

title: Kev Crane: Singing plumber signs Hollywood film deal
description: Kev Crane secured a record contract after being overheard singing while fitting a bathroom.

title: SEND review: Children to receive earlier support in new government plans
description: Critics say more urgency is needed to fix a "broken system", as a long-awaited review is published.

title: MOTD Top 10: Should Harry Kane move in search of that elusive Premier League title?
description: This week's MOTD Top 10 podcast is all about those stars who probably deserve a Premier League title win on their CV, but have never taken that final step to become champions.

title: Ukraine: Sheltering with monks in a Romanian monastery
description: The Ukrainian family who found shelter in a an unlikely place after fleeing Kharkiv.

title: Medvedev moves closer to top ranking with win over Martinez
description: Russia's Daniil Medvedev is two wins away from regaining the men's world number one spot after reaching the Miami Open last 16.

title: Knoydart community owns Britain's remotest mainland pub
description: Locals succeed in their bid to buy The Old Forge on the Knoydart Peninsula in a landmark deal.

title: The Papers: Abramovich poisoning and first Partygate fines
description: The alleged chemical poisoning of the Russian tycoon and fines for Downing Street parties lead the papers.

title: Shane Warne: Australians reflect on cricket legend and 'man of the people'
description: Ahead of Warne's memorial service, ordinary Australians explain why his legacy transcends cricket.

title: Anoosheh Ashoori tells of Iran jail 'hell'
description: Anoosheh Ashoori, who arrived back in the UK this month, tells of his 'hell' in Tehran jail.

title: Ukraine war: Odesa defies Russia and embraces signs of life
description: Residents of the historic city on Ukraine's coast are confident it will not fall to Russian forces.

title: Will Smith apologises to Chris Rock after Oscars slap
description: The actor says he was "out of line" after he slapped the comedian on stage at the Oscars.

title: French election: Why the small town of Moissac is on edge
description: The relationship between a Bulgarian community and locals in Moissac sheds light on political issues.

title: Biodiversity: What is it and how are we protecting it?
description: The planet is experiencing its sixth mass extinction event, but it is hoped action can be agreed.

title: Climate change: Heatwave temperature threshold raised in England by Met Office
description: As the UK's climate warms, the temperature threshold in eight counties is raised by the Met Office.
